Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madscot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in Rome, and easily accessible to major sites. I walked to the Vatican, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc., without issue. I booked this hotel for a weekend that I tacked on to a business trip, so I was solo. The room was small, but comfortable. The toilet was actually located in the shower, but everything worked well. The staff is very helpful and accommodating. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again or recommend it to someone wanting a convenient place to stay without spending a lot of $. There's a great restaurant across the street, and plenty of places to get a cappuccino or a quick bite to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stuart S
Reviews.Content: Stayed with some friends at this hotel in October. It was an ideal choice for us. The hotel is very basic but the location is great, a 5 minute walk from the station. It was easy to walk to all the sights in Rome from the hotel. I would recommend this if you are looking for a cheap convienient hotel. Its not 5 star luxury so if you want that you will have to pay a lot more!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SlovakTraveller777
Reviews.Content: Can recommend for its central location. Nice staff. Room a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Witchy121
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find, not far from the Termini, walking distance to major sites. Very very clean and the hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Although on a busy road we did not have a problem with noise. I have been to Rome a few times now and this hotel was exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Staff extremely helpful and nice. great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Ido K
Reviews.Content: The receptionist knows everything you can do in Rome, where to eat, where to shop and what to see. the room was clean and we were pretty suprised when we arrived to the hotel. the location is just perfect, 8 minutes walk to colosseum and other landmarks, 3 minutes from main railway/subway station. prices are not so high to Rome. the bad things: elevator not so efficient, shower is not really comfortable since water does not drip out very well.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has gone out of business”
Reviews.Author: RichardDallas
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this hotel has closed its doors. We had a reservation for one night in Sept 09 and only learned that the hotel had closed when we arrived and found the doors padlocked and the windows covered over. They didn't notify their existing reservations holders to this, so it came as a total surprise and forced us to find a last minute replacement hotel. We stated at the Hotel Marcantonio a few floors up from where Hotel Everest used to be. Not sure if they plan to reopen or not, but I'd suggest not taking any chances if they do.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect low cost base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: ValhallaGirl
Reviews.Content: We are a 30 something aged American couple who stayed here over a busy weekend in June. Hotel is very convenient (5 minutes) to train station and buses and we felt very safe here. We often even walked to or from major attractions within 20-25 minutes and enjoyed wandering the neighborhoods. Staff was helpful and hotel was quiet and nice. Our double room had three beds (one double and two twins) a small refrigerator and TV, shower and bathroom and central air conditioning that was on all the time. Would definitely stay here again. Only critique was that breakfast was very light, with only dried packaged toast and croissants, jam and a bit of coffee in plastic cups. But there are cheap little shops just across the street and we kept juice and yogurt in our fridge to supplement breakfast. There is no internet but the peace, quiet, cleanliness and convenience made up for it. So much better than the hostel stay I had in Rome in my 20s! Perfect for people who want a convenient base for seeing Rome. It does not have hang out space, which probably helps it be quiet, and for those seeking that, I would recommend a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “It has the basics”
Reviews.Author: Ande214
Reviews.Content: Hotel Everest has your basic needs for a simple stay in Rome. It is a five minute walk from Termini (the train station), down Cavour, so that is convenient. The hotel is on the third floor of the building, so that was different. Take the elevator to the third floor if there are only two of you because no one else will fit. We walked up all the stairs upon our arrival b/c we didn't know it was on the third floor. The hotel staff provided us with a map when we arrived and pointed out all the bus routes and major sites to see, so that was helpful. The room is very basic, the bathroom is simple and there is not a view. We had trouble with the water going down in the shower, the toilet flushing, and the blow dryer does not have a whole lot of power (if that is something that you would use). Breakfast is also very basic. It had some things we couldn't identify in wrappers, some bread, and coffee and juice. We could pay with credit card though when we checked out, unlike I read in a different review. All in all, it is clean and a place to sleep if you are going to be out all day exploring Rome and do not care a whole lot about your bathroom amenities or breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Situated Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeedsTravelBug
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great trip to Rome, staying at the Hotel Everest 1. We've stayed at a budget hotel in the city before so we sort of knew what to expect and we weren't disappointed. The location is excellent for people arriving at Termini train station/bus from Ciampino airport as it's no more than 5 mins walk to the hotel, convenient when carrying luggage. The hotel is 3 floors up so I recommend taking the lift when you first arrive and not attempting to walk up with all your luggage, like i did! The room is basic but what do you need whan you're out sight seeing - you don't go to Rome to sit in your room all day. It was was clean, comfortable and the bathroom was of an adequate size for two sharing. Fresh towels were provided daily. The view wasn't great - we were overlooking washing lines but that didn't bother us. Breakfast was simple, pastries with a choice of hot drinks and juice, plenty to start a day touring the city. Staff were very friendly on arrival, giving us plenty of information about the major attractions and advice about the metro. The only downside was on checking out, they hadn't taken the correct details about our payment on arrival (which must be in cash only when you arrive). We had to speak to the receptionist that had booked us in on the mobile phone of the receptionist on duty. Luckily he remembered us. Keep your receipt as proof when checking out! I would definitely stay at this hotel again next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Siru”
Reviews.Author: Zue
Reviews.Content: I don´t hesitate to recommend this Hotel. It´s nice, clean, simple and stuff is also very kind. Locations is exellent, and breakfast was definetely enought for us -cup of coffee, glass of orange juice, croissants and toasts -that´s all what we need to start beautiful day in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah84
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, all the staff were very friendly and helpful with providing information about the local area when we needed advice and on arrival. The location is also great. During our 6 night stay we only used the metro once (to go to the Vatican) and were able to walk to all the other sites of interest within 30-40mins at a leisurely stroll. The room had enough space for 2 suitcases (although the bathroom was very narrow) and was not cramped. It was cleaned every day and kept in very good condition. One thing we were worried about when we booked the hotel was that it was on one of the busiest roads in Rome, but we actually found that in our room we couldn't hear the roads at all! The room faced away from the room but we had no noise at all. Breakfast was basic but nice and was all that we wanted - hot drinks or juice and pastries that were fresh, toast, marmalades, etc. Security was never a concern as the hotel is on 3rd floor (there is a lift though), and the street is well-lit. Overall, it was a very positive experience that we had in this hotel, I would recommend it for a great stay in Rome!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Everest 1
